column1: Extreme Discomfort in Calves when Sitting or Lying Down
column2: wewilly, 65-74 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: used for 5 days have severe side effects that have been going on for 5 weeks and cannot get under control (edema,pneumona,laryngitis,nasal obstruction,difficulty breathing,wheezing) have been to 3 DRS. no one can pin it down or fix it going to Rochester MN hospital soon

column2: NCKate, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Taking for RLS about a month. Mixed results, as some nights it works great; others I'm pacing the floor again. I go back for my check up in the morning, and I'm anxious to go over this inconsistency in results. When it works, it's awesome - SO nice to be able to sleep for more than an hour or so at a time before being forced out of bed to pace!

column2: AnneNC, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prescribed for restless legs, and it is working (so far) very well! 2 weeks into it, so it's a little early yet, but the results so far are very encouraging. I'm actually able to go to sleep and stay asleep through the night. Major change from pacing the floor for hours at night. Little grogginess, some dizziness in the morning, but that beats the heck out of only getting 1-2 hours of sleep at a time, with nightly totals of 3.5 to 6 every night!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ended in ER with allergic rash over body that felt like prickly heat. Did not help with jerking motion of upper body during night. Horrible experience.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Horizant was prescribed for me after Ambien CR no longer kept me asleep.  In the past I'd also tried Ambien, Rozerem, and Trazadone.

column1: Extreme Discomfort in Calves when Sitting or Lying Down
column2: Kay, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took one dose at 5PM Extreme side effects next day - could not walk on my own, kept falling asleep, slurred my words when trying to converse.  Will never use this drug again!

column1: Extreme Discomfort in Calves when Sitting or Lying Down
column2: RAC, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The Directions for this say to take at about 5pm, I take it about 2 hours before I want to go to bed (since that is how long until it make me sleepy). If I take it at bedtime I will either oversleep or be very groggy in the morning.

column2: Wels, 65-74 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've slept better. However, my mental clarity has been Afected in the mornings. Don't think as clearly as normal. Kinda a druggy afterefect. Lasts into the late mornings. My wife has noticed my attitude has changed a bit my driving is different. I'm looking for another avenue to help me slep.

column1: Extreme Discomfort in Calves when Sitting or Lying Down
column2: mutdog, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The RLS restless legs that I had was unbearable...I dreaded each evening as it would begin and be relentless. Horizant began to work almost immediately..I am even sleeping better and uncontrollable movements are practically nonexistent.  Yes, I was groggy the first week but have acclimated to that.  Honestly, this has been like a miracle for me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 85% relief from restless legs.  Leaves me a little dopey in the morning but that seems to clear up by the time I leave ir work

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Jene, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Has effectively stopped uncontrollable movements caused by extreme Restless Legs Syndrome.  Before using Horizant, RLS seizures were extreme throughout entire body.  Side effects of dizziness, etc. disappeared after a couple of days.  I can now sleep, which the RLS previously prevented.
